NORWALK, Conn., Nov. 27 -- Local teachers voted yesterday 403 to 282, against representation for bargaining purposes by the Norwalk Federation of Teachers, a branch of the United Federation of Teachers. The teachers are now represented by the Norwalk Teachers Association, which will continue as the bargaining unit.
"Ballad for a Firing Squad," a musical, has postponed its premiere from Dec. 8 to Dec. 11 at the Theater de Lys. Previews will begin tomorrow night.
PITTSBURGH, Nov. 27 (UPI) -- Mike Walton's goal with less than two minutes to play in the third period earned the Toronto Maple Leafs a 3-3 tie with the Pittsburgh Penguins tonight.

The appointment of Karl H. Kreder as vice president and director of urban affairs of the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company was announced yesterday. He formerly was head of the company's home office personnel staff.
Today is Thanksgiving Day. Following is a list of facilities and services that are affected:
The Rangers' performance last night sent Boom Boom Geoffrion into a tirade for the first time since he became the club's coach, following their 4-2 loss to the Chicago Black Hawks.

HONG KONG, Nov. 27 -- The British colonial Government, reacting to Communist protests, announced today that it had forbidden an American film unit to shoot several sequences here of the movie "The Chairman."

BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 27 (AP) -- President Tito granted an amnesty today of reduction of sentence to 936 prisoners on the 25th aniversary of the founding of a national assembly by Partisans on the territory they had liberated from German troops.
BALTIMORE, Nov. 27 -- Mr. McCourt, a 32-year-old bachelor, was reported missing to the state police June 6 by Marvin Mandel, Speaker of the Maryland House of Delegates.

MEXICO CITY, Nov. 27 (AP) -- One student was killed and 30 were wounded today in a violent clash among student factions battling over whether to continue Mexico's four-month-old student strike, the police reported.

WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 -- Julius W. Hobson, a Negro militant whose law suit led to a landmark school desegregation decision, emerged today as the likely president of this city's first elected school board.

WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 -- Consumer prices rose six-tenths of 1 per cent in October, the biggest monthly jump during the current spell of inflation, the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the Department of Labor reported today.
Two men who the police assert are responsible for 32 holdups in Harlem in the last year were taken into custody yesterday by detectives of the West 135th Street squad.

Directors of the American Re-Insurance Company elected yesterday Merl L. Rouse as chairman and chief executive officer. Donald R. MacKay, who has been executive vice president, succeeds Mr. Rouse as president.
A public hearing will begin Dec. 16 on charges by the Security and Exchange Commission against 14 institutional investors in the insiders case involving Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner Smith, Inc.

NORTH TARRYTOWN, N. Y., Nov. 27 -- Towering fireballs followed a series of explosions last night in propane gas tanks adjacent to the huge General Motors auto body plant here, causing several thousand nightshift workers to flee.

DETROIT, Nov. 27 (UPI) -- Denny McLain, who turned the first 31-victory season by a pitcher in 37 years into a unanimous sweeping of the Cy Young and most valuable player awards this year, has signed his 1969 contract -- apparently for less than the $100,000 he said he wanted.
PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27 (AP) -- The Philadelphia Phillies today sold a relief pitcher, John Boozer, to their Pacific Coast League farm in Eugene, Ore.
Prices on the London Stock Exchange finished lower yesterday despite a firmer market trend toward the close.

Robert M. Morgenthau, United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York said yesterday he would testify at hearings by the House Banking and Currency Committee on Dec. 9 concerning illegal securities transactions channeled through foreign banks.
GENEVA, Nov. 27 -- William M. Roth, President Johnson's special trade adviser, urged today that other industrial nations now press for trade liberalization, rather than the United States.
NEWARK, Nov. 27 (AP) -- Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio said today he would call in the National Guard and the state police if city policemen and firemen resorted to a slowdown.

JERSEY CITY, Nov. 22 (AP) -- Superior Court Justice Robert Matthews ruled today that shareholders of the United States Lines Company could meet as scheduled Friday to vote on a merger with Walter Kidde Co.

SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 27 -- For most of the summer and early fall, the big questions facing Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky were whether to strap on his scuba gear or his water skis, whether to hunt or to fish, whether to play a hand of poker or a round of mahjongg.
The United States Steel Corporation moved yesterday to end the price war in the steel industry.

ROME, Nov. 27 -- L'Osservatore della Domenica, the Vatican's weekly newspaper denies that the retirement of Giacomo Cardinal Lercaro, former Archbishop of Bologna, was plotted by members of the Roman Curia.

Several corporate boards voted yearend extra dividends yesterday in addition to regular quarterly dividends. Other company boards increased the regular dividend while recommending stock splits, which generally require shareholder approval.

TEL AVIV, Nov. 28 (Reuters) -- Israeli troops killed all five members of an Arab guerrilla band intercepted last night in in the region of Al Hamma in the southern sector of the Golan Heights, an Israeli Army spokesman announced here.

PEKING, Nov. 27 (Agence France-Presse) -- China has been "tempered" by its Cultural Revolution and will now be in a better position to help the African, Arab and other peoples of the world in "their just struggles" against American imperialism and Soviet "modern revisionism" Chi Peng-fei, Vice Minister for Foreign Affairs, said here today.

After touring the charred ruins of a vandalized synagogue in Brooklyn -- the 11th Jewish house of worship to be desecrated in the last three months -- Mayor Lindsay yesterday broadcast a six-point action program calling for more police surveillance of all religious buildings and the organization of a special arson squad.
The National Broadcasting Company announced yesterday that it has signed Andy Williams to a new long-term contract for a one-hour weekly musical variety series, starting next fall.
Narcotics smuggling charges against a Maryland State Senator, who is being sought abroad by Federal agents, have been disclosed by the United States attorney's office in Brooklyn.
ROCHESTER, Nov. 27 (UPI) -- Mr. Humphrey hunted birds today with his sons, Robert and Douglas, and members of his staff.
RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 27 (UPI) -- Max Conrad, the 66-year-old "flying grandfather," arrived here today on a 34,000-mile round-the-world flight over both poles from St. Louis.
PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27 (AP) -- Dr. Gayle K. Lawrence, executive director of the Philadelphia Commission on Higher Education, was named president of Girard College today.
SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 27 -- A fugitive warrant was issued today for the arrest of Eldridge Cleaver, fiery Black Panther leader.

The decision on state negotiating units issued yesterday by the Public Employment Relations Board has cleared the way for a rational resolution of the dispute that caused illegal strikes in four state mental hospitals. The only question that remains unresolved is why all the disputants could not have avoided provocative acts until the decision came down.
PORT - AU - PRINCE, Haiti, Nov. 26 -- The land of voodoo has just witnessed another dazzling example of magic.
SINCLAIR Oil, which is apparently not Wall Street's favorite oil company, may just wind up the year as the hottest take-over candidate on the Big Board.
Public hearings to work out a "precise definition" of death for potential donors of transplant organs will begin next month before a nine-member state commission, it was announced yesterday.

THE Alwin Nikolais Dance Company is the latest in the procession of leading modern-dance troupes to appear at the Brooklyn Academy of Music as part of its glittering Festival of Dance. The company has come more or less directly from its success at the Paris Dance Festival and this week's season -- it runs through Sunday -- is its very first extensive engagement in a large New York theater.
ATHENS, Nov. 27 -- Greece's army - backed regime today stripped the royal family of its say in the running of several public welfare institutions.
WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 -- The United States was reported tonight to be preparing to accept Communist China's proposal for a meeting in Poland with representatives of the Nixon Administration on Feb. 20.
There was the aura of a trance ritual at the Fillmore East last night as the Incredible String Band from Britain gave its first major concert here.

Junior and senior high-school students demonstrated at City Hall yesterday to protest the loss of holidays and the addition of daily classroom time to make up for time lost during the recent teachers' strikes.

Nelson Rockefeller's conclusion that he should not leave his post as Governor assures New York State that his vision and experience will once again be available to help cope with the difficult problems Albany must face in the coming legislative session.

SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 27 -- Prime Minister John Gorton said today that the Australian Government was not having second thoughts about buying the F-111 fighter-bomber but that the plane would have to meet certain standrads before delivery was accepted.

WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) -- The Federal Aviation Administration said today it was studying various means, including use of electronic screening devices, to combat the modern-day pirate, the airplane hijacker. The acting administrator David Thomas said his agency was exploring "every possible avenue both domestically and on the international side for curbing this vicious crime by apprehending the criminal before he acts."
HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 28 (Reuters) -- Two Finnish passenger ships collided in fog in the mouth of the Gulf of Bothnia last night, according to reports reaching here today.

UP AGAINST THE IVY WALL: A History of the Columbia Crisis. By Jerry L. Avorn and members of the staff of the Columbia Daily Spectator. Edited by Robert Friedman. Illustrated. 307 pages. Atheneum. Hardcover, $6.50; paperback, $3.25. CRISIS AT COLUMBIA: Report of the Fact-Finding Commission Appointed to Investigate the Disturbances at Columbia University in April and May, 1968. 222 pages. Random House/Vintage. Paperback, $1.95.

BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 27 (UPI) -- Doug Roberts's first goal of the season capped an Oakland comeback tonight as the Seals rallied from a 3-0 first-period deficit to tie the Minnesota North Stars, 3-3, in a National Hockey League game.

When the Simon Ackerman men's wear stores went out of business four years ago many New Yorkers waxed nostalgic about the departure of another chain and the elimination of the Ackerman name from the apparel scene.
DENVER, Nov. 27 (AP) -- The Federal Government went to court yesterday seeking to shut down the diet pill operations of Western Research Laboratories of Denver.
Stock prices continued to roll ahead yesterday but with less vigor than on Tuesday.

BOSTON, Nov. 27 (AP) -- The Massachusetts Advisory Board of Pardons recommended unanimously today that the life sentence given one of the 11 Brink's bandits be commuted, making him eligible for parole.
MOSCOW, Nov. 27 (UPI) -- Soviet scientists are studying plans for turning astronauts into farmers and Russian spaceships into flying "hothouses."
YOUNGSTOWN, OHIO, Nov. 27 (UPI) -- Today was the last day of classes until next year for 28,060 Youngstown children because the city school system is out of money.

Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that a special report, which had criticized Vincent F. Albano Jr., the Manhattan Republican chairman, for "unwise and probably unethical" conduct, confirmed Mr. Albano's "personal and political integrity."
MOSCOW, Nov. 27 -- The Soviet Union, in publishing today details of its 1969 aid program for North Vietnam, emphasized the supply of civilian goods rather than military equipment.

The election of Henry M. Curran, former chairman of the New York State Senate Banking Committtee, as a member of the board of trustees of the Emigrant Savings Bank, was announced yesterday. Mr. Curran is now a partner in Curran, Cooney and Norman F. Penny Agency, Inc., insurance agents, Garden City, L. I.

That brutal creep Scarpia in Puccini's "Tosca" is none of your run-of-the-precinct policemen, although he is sometimes played like one. He is a baron who dabbles at being police commissioner of Rome because the job offers limitless opportunities for indulging his tastes in lechery and sadism.
THE fashion game is for-children, too. Elegance, sophistication, prices, it's all there for toddlers and for the boys and girls impatiently waiting to become teen-agers.

RIVERHEAD, L. I., Nov. 27 -- The Suffolk County Board of Supervisors decided tonight to use a bookkeeping device to avoid imposing a sales tax and raising property taxes above the constitutional limit to balance the proposed county budget for next year.

KINGSTON, N. Y., Nov. 27 (AP) -- A Marine corporal who pleaded guilty to manslaughter in the strangling of a 19-year-old girl was sentenced to up to 20 years in prison today. The corporal, Lewis Benjamin, 21, of Mount Marion, had been charged with first-degree murder in the killing of Brenda Jean Benson of High Woods last April 12.
Barge traffic on the Mississippi River may double by 1980, according to John Creedy, president of the Water Transport Association.
LANSING, Mich., Nov. 27 (AP) -- Gov. George Romney said today that he had not been offered a position in the Administration of Mr. Nixon and did not know if such an offer would be made.
The American Bankers Association has issued a sharp attack on the proposed Uniform Consumer Credit Code, which would overhaul all consumer lending legislation in the United States.

Government and tax-exempt fixed - income securities declined slightly in price yesterday, while a few new corporate bond issues rose a little. Because it was the day before a holiday, trading activity was unusually light.

The essential element in any code of ethics for elected persons is public disclosure. There are rules for disclosure of election campaign finances under the Corrupt Practices Act, but evasions have become a game with breaches unpunished. It is on the personal level of disclosure -- a Congressman's business interests and sources of income beyond his Government salary -- that public knowledge can serve as a shield.
The new South Korean freighter Korean Pioneer, the latest addition to that nation's growing merchant fleet, is scheduled to make her debut here over the weekend.
WASHINGTON, NOV. 27 (AP) -- The Federal Communications Commission stripped WNJR, a Newark radio station, of its license today, saying the station committed "gross misconduct and fraud."

PARIS, Nov. 27 -- A new kind of nervousness is afflicting many departing passengers these days at Orly Airport, nine miles south of Paris, as customs officials enforce currency restrictions by peeking into wallets and handbags and prying into suitcases.

ISTANBUL, Turkey, Nov. 27 (Reuters) -- A Chrysler Valiant estate car, driven by British stockbroker Reg Lewis, collided with a truck six miles from here today and was forced to pull out of a 10,000-mile London-to-Sydney rally.

SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 27 -- President Nguyen Van Thieu announced tonight that he had appointed his chief political rival, Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky, to "oversee and control" the Saigon delegation to the expanded Paris talks.

SAN JOSE, Calif., Nov. 27 (AP) -- Joseph Barrios's ride in an astronaut's centrifuge has moved a bullet in his brain to a less-dangerous spot and he may not have to undergo an operation, his doctor reported today.
This is Thanksgiving Day and Americans across the nation prepared to celebrate it in the tradition established by the Pilgrims 347 years ago.

PARIS, Nov. 27 -- The French Culture Ministry's music department is deciding who will take over from Charles Munch as the head of France's most recently organized orchestra, the Orchestre de Paris, according to informed sources.

ATLANTA, Nov. 27 (AP) -- Officials at Holy Family Hospital in Atlanta said the Rev. Ralph David Abernathy was admitted late today, but that they would have no report on his condition before Thursday morning.
BROOKVILLE, L.I ., Nov. 27 -- Hofstra and C. W. Post will be missing seniors tomorrow when they meet in their annual season-ending football game at 10:30 A.M.
WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (Reuters) -- Britain became today the first nuclear power to ratify the East-West treaty to bar the spread of nuclear weapons.
PARIS, Nov. 27 -- The French franc failed to pick up any strength in the foreign-exchange market today, following the austerity program announced by Premier Maurice Couve de Murville.
SACRAMENTO, Nov. 27 (UPI) -- Lieut. Gov. Robert H. Finch of California said today that he had been offered his choice of several positions in Mr. Nixon's Cabinet.

The State Insurance Department filed charges of racial discrimination against the Royal-Globe Insurance Companies yesterday, charging they had canceled 309 fire insurance policies in Harlem and Bedford-Stuyvesant within the last two weeks.
Chance is a loud-spoken byword in the investment world, but a significant one has been happening quietly this year in connection with the small investor. It may have been almost unnoticed.

WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) -- The theme of President-elect Richard M. Nixon's inauguration is being changed from "Bring Us Together" -- the slogan he adopted after seeing it on a sign at a campaign rally -- to "Forward Together."
Jon M. Lindbergh, oceanographer, who is the son of Charles A. Lindbergh, has been retained to find the missing sea-leg of the hydrofoil vessel Victoria in Puget Sound.

TOKYO, Nov. 27 -- Premier Eisaku Sato, at a news conference after his re-election as president of the Liberal-Democratic party, hinted today that he would use his mandate to seek an increase in Japan's military strength.
PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27 (AP) -- The head of a plumbers union local was indicted today by a Federal grand jury on charges of "stealing, embezzling and converting to his own use" funds of the local.
DETROIT, Nov. 27 -- The Ford Motor Company recalled 81,200 Ford and Mercury 1969 cars to correct a potential safety defect.
BOSTON, Nov. 27 (AP) -- Two brothers from the Roxbury section were arrested today in connection with the slaying of three men in a civil rights office Nov. 13.

MOSCOW, Nov. 27 (AP) -- The official press agency, Tass, said today that North Vietnam had the right to shoot down United States reconnaissance planes that fly over its territory. The United States maintains that the bombing halt does not rule out continued reconnaissance flights.

BONN, Nov. 27 -- The youth's death, which was given grim display in the West German press today, prompted Chancelor Kurt Georg Kiesinger to ask his Cabinet at the regular meeting this morning to explore chances for an agreement with East Germany to evacuate injured fugitives by West German helicopter.

WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 27 -- The fact that Best Of All never has gone the mile-and-a-quarer distance of Saturday night's National Pacing Derby at Roosevelt Raceway did not deter the linemaker today from making that 5-year-old pacer the even-money favorite to win the Nassau County course's oldest major pacing event.
CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 27 -- Gunnar Myrdal, the Swedish sociologist and statesman, invited his "fellow students" at Harvard last night to share an adventure with him.
BAMAKO, Mali, Nov. 27 -- The transistorized citizens of this West African country learned of the overthrow of President Modibo Keita last week in a song.

While eight outstanding professional tennis players compete for $20,000 in prize money at Madison Square Garden today through Saturday, their tour directors eagerly await the outcome of another money match in Europe.

Former Water Commissioner James L. Marcus, tieless and wearing baggy blue pants and a blue prison-issued windbreaker, pleaded not guilty yesterday to a charge of accepting a $20,000 bribe to approve a Consolidated Edison power-line route over city-owned land.

HOUSTON, Nov. 27 (UPI) -- Three dummy astronauts rode through a rough landing in an Apollo spacecraft in an apparently successful test of the new, more shock-resistant couch supports installed abroad the Apollo 8 moonship, the space agency said today.

SAN JOSE, Calif., Nov. 27 (AP) -- Joseph Barrios's ride in an astronaut's centrifuge has moved a bullet in his brain to a less-dangerous spot and he may not have to undergo an operation, his doctor reported today.
LISBON, Nov. 27 -- Premier Marcelo Caetano closed the door today to any change on Portugal's policy in Africa but left it ajar to some change domestically.

Acting Controller of the Currency Justin T. Watson announced yesterday approval of a series of "phantom bank" mergers, each designed to facilitate the formation of a one-bank holding company. Among the banks involved were the United States National Bank, Portland, Ore., American Fletcher National Bank and Trust Company, Indianapolis, the Third National Bank, Nashville, the Capital National Bank, Houston, and the Birmingham Trust National Bank, Birmingham, Ala.

PORTSMOUTH, N. H., Nov. 27 (AP) -- The experimental submarine Dolphin, having attained what the Navy termed a "significant milestone" by reaching test depths for which she was designed, returned today to the Portsmouth Naval Shipyard.

MONTREAT, N.C., Nov., 27 (UPI) -- The Rev. Billy Graham, the evangelist, said today that he had accepted an invitation from Gen. Creighton W. Abrams Jr., the allied commander in Vietnam, to visit troops in South Vietnam in the Christmas season.

WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) -- Army physicians reported today that former President Dwight D. Eisenhower was "able to walk a short distance unassisted" as he continues to make "slow but steady progress" from his most recent heart attack.

TOKYO, Nov. 27 (AP) -- The Japan Skating Federation picked three collegians today for the world figure skating championship to be held in Colorado Springs, Colo., Feb. 25 through March 2 next year. They were Tsuguhiko Kozuka, Kazzumi Yamashita and Keiko Miyagawa.

BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 27 -- Hundreds of demonstrators, apparently Albanian nationalists, smashed shop windows and overturned cars today in Pristina, the capital of the heavily Albanian province of Kosovo-Metohija in southern Yugoslavia.

Mrs. Henry Duncan Wood 3d will give a buffet supper on Saturday at her home for the young women to be presented at the Greensleeves Ball on Dec. 26 in the Terrace Room of the Roosevelt Hotel. Among the debutantes are
The Standard Oil Company (Indiana) proposed yesterday the acquisition of the Cerro Corporation in an exchange of stock valued at about $360-million.
CHICAGO, Nov. 27 (AP) -- Swift Co. reported today a loss of $42-million, or $3.57 a share, for the fiscal year ended Oct. 26.
LONE STAR, Tex., Nov. 27 (AP) -- Two plant security guards, shot while patrolling the grounds of the strikebound Lone Star Steel Company, were reported in satisfactory condition today.

THE story of a diminutive shoe clerk who played a prominent role in the development of canoeing as a sport in the United States is engagingly told in Atwood Manley's and Paul Jamieson's "Rushton and His Times in American Canoeing" (The Adirondack Museum - Syracuse University Press, 197 pages, illustrated, $14).

An organization of landlords said yesterday it had filed suit in State Supreme Court to force the city's Housing and Development Administration to make public a study of rent control said to be "highly critical."

The Royal Bank of Canada, Canada's largest bank, reported yesterday net profits for the year ended Oct. 31 of $35,324,403, up 16.7 per cent from the $30,278,555 earned the preceding year. Total assets of the bank were $8.7-billion, up from $7.8-billion on Oct. 31, 1967.

WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI) -- The Justice Department said today that Billie Sol Estes, serving a 15-year Federal prison sentence for swindling, had asked President Johnson to commute his sentence. Estes, who was involved in a multimillion-dollar swindle, has been in the Sandstone, Minn., Federal prison since March, 1965.

Palauli, a young campaigner with victories to his credit at Belmont Park and at Laurel, carried his effectiveness over to Aqueduct yesterday. The 2-year-old gelding owned by Powhatan and trained by Frank Whiteley Jr., uncovered a thrilling closing burst to win the $29,200 Remsen Stakes.
WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) -- Cities eager to move against rate in slums are still wainting for Federal money that was authorized a year ago.

The Chase Manhattan Bank and the Shapiro Brothers Factors Corporation announced yesterday that an agreement had been signed for Chase to acquire Shapiro, a privately owned concern. Shapiro stockholders will get 224,837 shares of Chase stock.
ELMONT, L. I., Nov. 28 -Steve Caravona caught a 30yard touchdown pass and Steve Triolo raced 14 yards for another score as Sewanhaka downd Carey, 12-0 today.

TACOMA, Wash., Nov. 28 (AP) -- Alvin Karpis, the onetime leader of the notorious Karpis-Barker gang, who was Public Enemy No. 1 in the nineteen-thirties, is spending his final days in prison planning a future as a clerk-typist.
KETCHIKAN, Alaska, Nov. 28 (AP) -- Winds gusting up to 100 miles an hour toppled three communications towers, broke windows and swamped small boats in the harbor here today.
FREETOWN, Sierra Leone, Nov. 28 (AP) -- Hundreds of skilled Mende tribesmen are fleeing from Sierra Leone's iron mines, threatening a cut in production, a company official says.
A series of five slide lectures on art at the ParkeBernet Galleries from Tuesday to Dec. 7 will benefit Channel 13, the educational television station.
ANGMERING, England, Nov. 28 (AP) -- The body of the Earl of Lauderdale, hereditary bearer of the national flag of Scotland, was washed up on a beach here yesterday. The police are investigating.

BONN, Nov. 28 (Reuters) -Foreign Minister Willy Brandt said today that critics of West Germany were mistaken in thinking the country wanted to use its economic strength to win a position of power in Europe.
ALBANY, Nov. 28 (AP) -Eleven students and an instructor at a junior college ended a 100-hour fast today aimed at drawing attention to hunger in America.

The elevators opened onto the elegantly appointed ground floor of the Pierre one day this week and out stepped a leader of the Yippies in a crushed denim suit and black boots, a staff member of Ramparts magazine with long, honey-colored hair and a matching cape, and about 15 other writers and editors.

DALLAS, Nov. 28 (AP) -Larry Cole, a rookie defensive tackle, intercepted a wobbly pass and raced 5 yards for a touchdown tonight to seal the Dallas Cowboys' 29-20 victory over the Washington Redskins in a National Football League game.

CHRISTCHURCH, New Zealand, Nov. 28 (AP) -- Denis Clark of New Zealand and Frank Phillips of Australia shot 68's and led after the first round of qualifying today for the New Zealand Open golf tournament.

FORT ORD, Calif., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- Pvt. Steve J. Limb, a 28-year-old South Korean native, celebrated Thanksgiving Day by starting basic army training here. Private Limb was a mascot with the 82d Airborne and 83d Armored Cavalry Divisions during the Korean contest He enlisted yesterday.
LONDON (AP) -- The British cross-channel rail-ferry service has ordered a second SRN-4 Hovercraft with capacity for 250 passengers and 30 automobiles, and costing about $4.2-million.
LONDON, Nov. 28 -- Britain's unusual import-deposit plan, aimed at reducing runaway imports, is coming under sharp attack at home and abroad.

WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (UPI) -- The Democratic party began its purge of the 1968 unfaithful today by taking steps to remove an Alabama Democratic national committeeman who failed to support the Humphrey-Muskie ticket.
Planned Parenthood of New York City announced yesterday that it would provide assistance to city government agencies to make birth control services readily available to poor families.
Terrence McNally, with three of his short plays now running off Broadway and on, has three more waiting in the wings.

SALEM, India (Reuters) -- A woman who fell into a large well while cutting grass near here was rescued alive, but nine persons who were watching the operation died when a platform on which they were standing collapsed.

BRUSSELS, Nov. 28 -- The six member states of the European Atomic Energy Community were unable to reach agreement today on the future of their joint program, and the 1969 budget was left in suspension.

Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that four priceless torahs, or Hebrew biblical scrolls, would be given by the Israeli Government to New York synagogues that have been victimized in the recent wave of religious desecrations.
MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Nov. 28 (AP) -- Minesota Pipers pulled away with a final-period spurt tonight to beat the Miami Floridians, 120-107, in the American Basketball Association
LONDON, Nov. 28 (AP) -- The statement of account of the Bank of England for the week ended Wednesday in thousands of pounds follow:
STONEWALL, Tex., Nov. 28 -- President Johnson spent the last Thanksgiving of his Presidency today at his beloved LBJ Ranch near here.
UTSUNOMIYA, Japan -- Takeshi Nakamura. 111 3/4 pounds, Japan, outpointed E.T.O. Sakdenoi, 112, Thailand, 12 rounds.
BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov. 28 -- Junior quarterback Mike Tetreau threw four touchdown passes as Roger Ludlowe of Fairfield trounced Bassick, 44-14, today. The Flying Tigers wound up an 8-2 season.
CAIRO, Nov. 28 -- Well-informed Egyptians reported today that the Moslem Brotherhood had stepped up its antiGovernment propaganda shortly before last week's outbreak of student rioting.

WAYNE, N. J., Nov. 28 -Gene Cheval kicked a 21-yard field goal with 1 minute 41 seconds left in the game today for the points that gave Wayne Valley its 25th straight victory, 23-21, over Passaic Valley. The streak, which includes nine games this year, is the longest in the state.
LAWRENCE, L. I., Nov. 28 -- A rugged Lawrence eleven threw a scare into Massapequa today, but a second-half rally gave the unbeaten Chiefs their eighth victory, 14-6.
CLARK, N. J., Nov. 28 -Intercepting four passes, Clark High turned back Scotch Plains, 13-7, today to capture the Watchung Conference championship for the first time.

The Fall National Championships of tire American Contract Bridge League begin tonight in Coronado, Calif., and a substantial contingent of New York enthusiasts will be fighting for five major titles during 10 days of play.

PARIS, Nov. 28 (UPI) -- Valerian A. Zorin, the Soviet Ambassador, conferred with President de Gaulle today for the second time within a week. Mr. Zorin said his visits had dealt "chiefly with the preparation of the forthcoming meeting of the French-Russian commission." on tle two nations economic, sci[entiHc and cultural cooperation.

Tilden posted its second victory in four P.S.A.L. Division II games by defeating Madison, 24-12, yesterday at Tilden Field. Ed Wilson scored once and passed 26 yards to Al Neubia for another Tilden touchdown.
A rising tide of capital expenditures by the nation's top 1,000 manufacturers has made itself felt in the third quarter of 1968, according to a survey of the National Industrial Conference Board.

MEXICO CITY, Nov. 28 (Reuters) -- Eighteen persons were hurt in a blaze today at a refinery of Pemex, the stateowned petroleum company at Azcapotazalco on the western outskirts of Mexico City. The fire was brought under control in two hours.

The West Virginia Pulp and Paper Company increased earnings nine per cent in the fourth fiscal quarter, ended Oct. 31, to a record of $7,105,000, or 68 cents a share, from $6,523,000, or 63 cents a share, in the similar three months last year, the company reports.

BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 28 -The Communist party in Jordan, in a clandestinely circulated pamphlet, is for the first time urging a brotherly cooperation" with the commando groups. The party had previously withheld support of the commandos in line with Soviet policy.
E. D. Hull has been elected a director and senior vice president of the Otis Elevator Company, with responsibility for the company's elevator and escalator operations in the United States and Canada.

MOSCOW -- The first testing area for Soviet-American relations under the Nixon Administration may well be the Middle East. It appears likely that the intensity of the Vietnam war will subside, removing one sore point, and that Moscow will succeed in reasserting the European status quo without another Czechoslovakia.

Broadcast Music, Inc., and the all-industry Radio Music reached an understanding on a new five-year B.M.I radio music performance license, it was announced yesterday by Elliott M. Sanger, chairman of the committee.

RAMSEY, N. J., Nov. 28 -Don Bosco completed its successful drive toward the Continental League championship in the North Jersey Catholic High School Conference today with a 27-25 victory over Bergen Catholic.
Hospital workers began returning to half-empty wards of four state mental institutions yesterday, ending a strike that had disrupted the lives of thousands of patients for more than a week.

MANCHESTER, Conn., Nov. 28 -- Ambrose Burfoot, 23 years old, of the Groton Athletic Club, the 1968 Boston Marathon champion, won the 32d five-mile Thanksgiving Day road race here today in 22 minutes 34.4 seconds.

BAYONNE, N. J., Nov. 28 -Gerry Castaldo threw three touchdown passes and his defense scored two third period safeties today as Bayonne captured Hudson County's championship with a 24-0 triumph over Marist. It was the eighth straight victory for the Bees, who lost their opener to North Bergen.

TRUMAN CAPOTE'S recollection or his boyhood in rural Alabama resulted last night in another warmly sensitive and human vignette entitled "The Thanksgiving Visitor,'' a perfect sequel to his earlier television success, "A Christmas Memory."

A COUPLE of months ago, Arnold deVignier Copper began selling men's clothes and accessories in his Greenwich Village living room. His friends poured in and began to buy not only the clothes, but some of the furniture.
American Export Isbrandtsen Lines and their general sales manager, the Diners-Fugazy Sales Corporation, are discovering that shuffleboard isn't quite as dead as they had assumed.
ENGLEWOOD, N. J,. Nov. 28 St. Cecilia's scored a 26-0 victory over Englewood today and completed its first undefeated season since 1951. Mike Alberque tallied two touchdowns.
RICHMOND, Nov. 28 (AP) A truck left Richmond last night loaded with food and clothing for the dependents of the 78 miners trapped in the West Virginia mines.
WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (UPI) -- The United States in the last 15 years has invested $8.8-billion in 67 big military contracts that were subsequently canceled, Defense Department figures showed today.
PARIS, Nov. 28 (Reuters) -Savings-account interest rates were raised today by one-half percentage point, to 3 1/2 per cent, the Bank of France announced.
ROANOKE, Va., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- Liberty Bowl-bound Virginia Tech turned four interceptions and two fumbles into touchdowns today and romped over Virginia Military Institute, 55-6.
LISBON (AP) -- In its continuing effort to modernize Portugal's agriculture, the government is making available 26.6-million escudos ($932,837) in loans to farmers and cooperatives.

ORANGE, N. J., Nov. 28 -Jim Baker's 5-yard touchdown run in the fourth period today enabled Orange to close out its most successful in years with a 6-2 victory over Belleville. The victory was the eighth in nine games for Orange.

LAUREL, Md., Nov. 28 (AP) -- After stewards dismissed a foul claim, Mister Diz, ridden by Hector Pilar, was sent to the winner's circle in the $25,750 Maryland Futurity at the Laurel Race Course today. A crowd of 14,512 saw the race.

The Felt Forum in Madison Square Garden Center, will show a closed circuit telecast of Joe Frazier's second defense of his world heavyweight title against Oscar Bonavena on Tuesday night, Dec. 10, it was announced yesterday by Harry Markson, the Garden's boxing director.

Applause, wholehearted and genuine, rang out at Aqueduct yesterday for Mrs. Richard C. du Pont's Politely. Competing in the $58,000 Firenze Handicap for fillies and mares and carrying the unfeminine burden of 131 pounds, Politely won the 1 1/8-mile event by 1 1/2 lengths over Obeah with Serene Queen next in the field of 11.

AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 28 (Reuters) -- Jordanian and Israeli forces exchanged fire for 20 minutes in the area of the Um al Shurati bridge in the northern Jordan valley tonight, a Jordanian military spokesman said.
Mayor Lindsay vetoed a bill yesterday that would have prohibited increases in carrying charges on publicly aided cooperative apartments more frequently than once every two years.
BUFFALO, Nov. 28 (AP) -- An explosion-punctured fire ripped through a building housing a restaurant-supply company today, causing damage estimated at $285,000. The building was destroyed.

MILLVILLE, N. J., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- An explosion ripped ripped through a two-story downtown building here today, touching off a blaze that leveled the structure and caused an estimate $250,000 damage. Two stores and an accounting office were demolished, but since the building was vacant at the time, no injuries were reported.
Two baroque and roll concerts at Philharmonic Hall got off to a rocky start last night but ended triumphantly, if not for the mating of classics and pop, at least for the star, Jimi Hendrix.

KEARNEY, N. J., Nov. 28 -Kearney concluded one of its most successful seasons in recent history with a 14-8 victory over Nutley today. Kearny, scoring all its points in the first period, wound up with a 7-2 won-lost record, while Nutley finished at 3-5-1.
NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 28 (AP) -- The daily double at the New Orleans Fair Grounds paid $1,372.40 today -- the record for an opening day.
SOUTH TOLWORTH, England (UPI) -- A green parakeet was on the loose here after chewing his way through the wire mesh of his cage. "He is fierce and has a nasty bite," said owner Jack Reed.
MIAMI, Nov. 28 (AP) -Angelico beat Burning Bridges by a nose today to win the $10,000added City of Miami Handicap at Lincoln Downs today.

SAN DIEGO, Calif., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- The San Diego Chargers yesterday activated two players from their taxi squad to play in this weekend's American football league game against the Broncos at Denver. Linebacker Ron McCall and a rookie offensive guard, Jim Schmedding, were added to the roster.
NORTH ARLINGTON, N. J., NOV. 28 -- Rich Casino and Vinnie Bellucci, halfbacks, scored two touchdowns each today and lead Queen of Peace to a 49-25 victory over Pope Pius.
WILTON, CONN., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- A tree limb fell on a power line here today, blacking out 200 homes for 44 minutes.
New Dorp. after trailing by 16-6 at the half, rallied in the final quarter to beat Curtis, 2216, yesterday at Port Richmond Field.
FAIR LAWN, N. J., Nov. 28 -- Ridgewood took second place in the Northern New Jersey Interscholastic League today with a 21-7 victory over Fair Lawn.

JERUSALEM, Nov. 28 -- An Israeli Army spokesman said today that five Arab infiltrators were killed last night in a clash with an Israeli patrol near the Sea of Galilee. There were no Israeli casualties, the spokesman said.
The next time you lose any money, don't feel bad -- you are just one of the seven million people who each year lose a total of about $2-billion in cash.

Miss Laurel Godfrey was introduced to society last night at a supper dance given at the St. Regis-Sheraton Roof by her stepfather and mother, Mr. and Mrs. DeSales Harrison Jr. of 620 Park Avenue and Honolulu. The debutante, who received the 300 guests with Mr. and Mrs. Harrison, wore a gown of ivory peau de soie appliqued with flowers of the same material.

NASHVILLE, Nov. 28 (AP) -Heavy rains, totaling more than 6 inches in spots, have pounded Tennessee from the Mississippi to the Cumberlands during the last 24 hours, threatening a major flood on the Harpeth River near here.

ROME, Nov. 28 (UPI) -- The Vatican began selling its Christmas stamp issue today and hundreds of stamp collectors lined up to buy. The stamps bear a design by the Polish artist Casimir Dabrowska of the "Baby Jesus of Prague," a painting that has been in the cathedral in the Czechoslovak capital for years.

NEWARK, Nov. 28 (AP) -The New Jersey Bell Telephone Company says it will tie into a nationwide Bell computer system on Dec. 26 to insure correct and more timely billing of interstate long distance calls.

SEATTLE, Nov. 28 (AP) -- A three-alarm fire raged uncontrolled for more than two hours at a Seattle shipworks plant today. More than 270 firemen and 30 units fought the fire at the Todd yards. Authorities reported several firemen suffered minor injuries and smoke inhalation.

The extent to which the "gimme" spirit has banished rationality in many aspects of labor-management relations is reflected in the 3-to-2 margin by which unionized employes of the Consolidated Edison System rejected a two-year pay agreement unanimously recommended by their union leaders.

PRINCETON, N.J., Nov. 28 -Dr. Aaron Lemonick, 45-yearold professor of physics at Princeton University will become dean of Princeton's Graduate School next July 1. He will succeed Colin S. Pittendrigh, who is resigning after 22 years at Princeton to become a professor of biology at Stanford University.
COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Nov. 28 (Reuters) -- Princess Margrethe, heir to the Danish throne, is expecting a baby in June, it was announced today.

BONN, Nov. 28 (UPI) -- A 4 per cent increase in taxes on exports and a 4 per cent decrease in levies on imports were approved tonight by the Bundestag as part of an international attempt to restore monetary balance.

CORAL GABLES, Fla. -- The national headquarters of the Organization for Tropical Studies is being established at the University of Miami, according to Dr. Howard J. Teas, a member of the university's biology faculty and secretary of the organization.
LONDON, Nov. 28 (Reuters) -- The death of two little boys turned rumblings of discontent over a British standard-time experiment into an angry outcry today.
President-elect Richard M. Nixon will send William S. Scranton to Israel and some Arab countries next week to discuss the situation in the Middle East.
SAN MATEO, Calif., Nov. 28 (AP) -- Majestic Prince, a $250,000 purchase as a yearling at Keeneland last year, won his first race today.

ROSELLE, N. J., Nov. 28 -Pulling away from underdog Roselle High in the last half today. Roselle Park scored a 39-12 victory in the 62d meeting of the teams -- the oldest holiday series in Union County. The victory enabled Roselle Park to finish third in the Garden State Conference, its highest ranking to date.
WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 -Jewish communities throughout the country were warned today not to underestimate the dangers of "new forms of antiSemitism" arising from the New Left.
MEDINA, Ohio, Nov. 28 (UPI) -- Five persons were killed and four others were injured in a two-car crash this afternoon at the intersection of Ohio 301 and 18, about 15 miles west of here.
TOKYO (Reuters) -- The Japanese Nisshin Flour Milling Company says that it will start full-scale production of artificial meat from wheat.
The Thanksgiving holiday traffic death toll climbed slowly but steadily yesterday. It was increased by multipledeath accidents.

OFF BROADWAY has invaded On Broadway and in a manner at once vigorous, lusty and disconcerting. That venerable (if it will excuse the term) Off Broadway outpost, the Circle in the Square, has taken over Henry Miller's Theater, and its very first production, "Morning, Noon and Night," threatens to raise a storm or at least promote a rumpus.

Lafayette remained undefeated in P.S.A.L. Division II play yesterday by overwhelming New Utrecht, 40-0, at Lincoln Field. It was the third league victory for the Frenchies, who lost only to Blew Rochelle in a nonleague game.

NORWALK, Conn., Nov. 28 -- Quarterback Darryll Dewan ran for three touchdowns and Robert Orellano added two 6-pointers as Danbury crushed Norwalk, 42-12 today. Danbury closed with a 9-2 record while Norwalk finished 4-5.
STANTON, Del., Nov. 28 (AP) -- The trustees of Delaware Park, Inc., today announced a record grant of $113,335 to seven Delaware hospitals, including $68,836 to the Wilmington Medical Center.
PARIS, Nov. 28 (AP) -- Britain should begin profressing toward her $1.2-billion annual balanceof-payments surplus next year, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development predicts.
TRENTON, Nov. 28 -- The Hughes administration announced today that the first $75-million in bonds authorized at the Nov. 5 referendum on a $990-million bond issue would go on sale Jan. 7
Lloyd Wilmot passed for the first touchdown and scored the second yesterday as Erasmus defeated Midwood, 20-0, in a P.S.A.L. Division II game at Midwood Field.

TRENTON, Nov. 28 (AP) -Gov. Richard J. Hughes has called the Hackensack River Meadowlands Development Plan a "venture of national significance" in letters to President Johnson and President - elect Richard M. Nixon.
TRENTON Nov. 28 (AP) -The State Board of Control has turned down a plea by Essex County welfare mothers for additional payments, including an extra $100 for school clothing.

NOUAKCHOTT, Mauritania, Nov. 28 (AFP) -- The West African country of Mauritania celebrated its eighth anniversary of independence today with a two-hour parade in the capital. President Moktar Ould Daddah later informed the National Assembly that exports were running at twice the volume of imports this year, giving the country a favorable trade balance of S40million.
MONTREAL, Nov. 28 (AP) -- The hockey future of Lorne (Gump) Worsley will not be decided before next week.

The head of Columbia University's Hudson Laboratories, at Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., has suggested that wobbles in the earth's spin may be responsible for such diverse phenomena as earthquakes, periods of mountain -building and climate
Teachers who report for work today will be paid even if their schools are closed or if they are prevented from entering by pickets.
A $1.3-million expansion is planned for Vanderbilt Hall, the 17-year-old home of the New York University School of Law.

It took Justice J. Irwin Shapiro less than six hours in Queens Supreme Court on Tuesday to hold a hearing and find two union leaders and a union local guilty of contempt in the strike against state mental hospitals.

FREEHOLD, N. J., Nov. 28 (AP) -- Air New Zealand, driven by James Smith, won the $5,000 Thanksgiving Day Pace at Free-hold Raceway today in 2:06.2. The winner was the odds-on favorite with the crowd of 5,952 and returned $3.40, $2.80 and $2.60 for $2 across the board.
The Williams Real Estate Company, Inc., has announced that Jules R. Byron has joined it as a vice president in the office leasing department.

SUMMIT, N. J., Nov. 28 -Steve Schoeder, junior quarterback, threw three touchdown passes to Dave Heitkamp and scored once as Summit High routed Chatham, 41-0, today. The victory enabled Summit to tie with New Providence as the Suburban Conference champion.
Moore-McCormack Lines has announced the appointment of Robert E. O'Brien as senior vice president.
TEHRAN, Iran, Friday, Nov. 29 (Reuters) -- Foreign Minister Corneliu Manescu of Rumania arrived here last night on a six-day official visit at the invitation of Foreign Minister Ardeshir Zahedi.

UNION CITY, N. J., Nov. 28 -- Steve Gibb, starting a varsity game for the first time, threw two touchdown passes to Art Youmans today as Union Hill defeated Emerson, 13-7. It was the 50th meeting between the teams.

LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- Navy aquanauts, pausing only long enough for the traditional Thanksgiving dinner, attached life-support and communications lines today to sealab III, the iron tank in which they soon will live and work for long periods on the ocean floor.
YONKERS, Nov. 28 -- Roosevelt clinched the Yonkers City League football championship today by defeating the Saunders-Commerce team, 38-0, at Roosevelt Field in the 37th game of their series.

GARFIELD, N. J., Nov. 28 -Clifton walloped Garfield, 54-7, today for its eighth victory in nine games. Gary Shenton scored four of his team's eight touchdowns, starting off with a 90-yard kickoff return. Garfield ended its season with a 6-3 won-lost record.

MANNINGTON, W. Va., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- The sixth of eight bore holes being drilled into areas of Mannington's No. 9 mine where 78 miners are trapped was completed today and air samples revealed that section also contained deadly carbon monoxide and methane.

WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 -- If you are looking for a position in the Nixon Administration, the chances are your letter or telephone call will be channeled to the seventh floor of a big red brick Government building here where a small but growing staff is opening, sorting, processing, pursuing, and filing sacks of applications.

CAERNARVON, Wales, Nov. 28 (AP) -- The police said today that they were investigating a tip that a threat had been made on the life of Prince Charles. The report came as Welsh extremists intensified their opposition to his investiture as Prince of Wales.

BANGUI, Central African Republic, Nov. 28 (Agence France-Press) -- The Government signed a commercial agreement with Hungary yesterday. Matya Domokos, Hungary's foreign commerce director, who was here for the signing, said that Hungary maintained relations with 18 African countries and had 40 economic posts in Africa.

HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 28 (Reuters) -- Three passengers were killed and one crewman was missing today after two Finnish passenger ships collided in fog in the Golf of Bothnia, Between Finland and Sweden, late last night.

WEST POINT, N.Y., Nov, 23 -- While Bonnie Cahill prepared turkey dinner in the brick house at the end of Partridge Place early this afternoon, her husband, Tom, was being a typical lazy man of the house. He lounged on a sofa in the den watching football on television.

STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 28 -- Halfback Jim Tully tallied three touchdowns as Stamford Catholic whipped Notre Dame of Bridgeport, 34-0, today Catholic and Notre Dame ended with identical 6-4 seasonal records.
ANNAPOLIS, Nov. 28 -- The United States Naval Academy plans to intensify, its recruiting in the next few years to attract more student athletes including football players.

Australian merchants, whose stores emulate most the Americans, are obtaining faster profit information on their sales than are Americans, and this enables them to make rapid strategic shifts in merchandising if needed, a retail trade association executive reported here recently.
JERUSALEM, Nov. 28 (Reuters) -- Israeli security forces today demolished a number of houses in the town of Hebron and the neighboring village Halhul, the Israeli radio said tonight.

BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 27 -- The civil rights movement in Northern Ireland, protesting the grievances of a large Roman Catholic minority, is hastening social change in this tense corner of Britain.

DETROIT, Nov. 28 (AP) -Sam Baker kicked four field goals to become the second leading National Football League point-scorer in history today as the Philadelphia Eagles registered their first victory of the season with a 12-0 triumph over the Detroit Lions.

LUSAKA, Zambia, Nov. 28 -President Kenneth D. Kaunda accused the political opposition today of launching a campaign of terror, with the support of Portuguese troops, in the remote northwestern corner of the country.

YONKERS, N. Y., Nov. 28 -Frank Spinella scored three touchdowns and Al Draper, a guard and linebacker, was outstanding on both offense and defense today as Gorton routed Yonkers, 52-0, at Lincoln Field in the 44th game of their city rivalry.

JONES BEACH, L.I., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- The police have identified the body of a man found fatally stabbed near Jones Beach yesterday as that of Peter Keres. The Long Island State Parkway Police said Mr. Keres's last known address was the St. George Hotel, 51 Clark Street, Brooklyn.
MT. VERNON, N. Y., Nov. 28 -- Kim Purcell threw four touchdown passes, two each to Ed Sforza and Joe Tartaglia, as Iona Prep defeated New Rochelle, 32-7, today at Memorial Field.

BONN, Nov. 28 -- The Finance Committee of the West German Bundestag, or lower house of Parliament approved today a Defense Committee recommendation purchase of 88 Phantom jets from the United States at a cost of $513-million.
TULSA, Okla., Nov. 28 (AP) -- Mike Stripling passed for two fourth-quarter touchdowns to lead Tulsa University to a 23-7 victory over Wichita State in a Missouri Valley Conference football game.
CHARLESTON, W. Va., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- A fire damaged Arlan's department store here today, destroying most of the store's newly purchased Christmas stock and causing damage estimated at $1-million.
ELYRIA, Ohio, Nov. 28 (UPI) -- Twenty-three persons were injured today on a 12-car collision on the Ohio Turnpike. Three were admitted to Elyria Memorial Hospital in fair condition.
JERSEY CITY, Nov. 28 -Gerard Jefferson ran for three touchdowns after recovering three St. Peter's fumbles as Dickinson defeated St. Peter's, 26-6, in the 60th renewal of their series.

STONEHAM, Mass., Nov. 28 (AP) -- A third man sought in the slayings of three men in the offices of a self-help organization Nov. 13 walked into police headquarters today and surrendered, the police said.
HONG KONG, Nov. 28 (AP) -- North Vietnam said today that its representatives would not talk to representatives of the South Vietnamese Government in Paris.
LONDON, Nov. 28 (UPI) -- A top aide to President-elect Richard M. Nixon got a briefing from one of the world's foremost military analysts yesterday and said he would stop in Paris before going home.

OKLAHOMA CITY, Okla., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- An Oklahoma City teen-ager died today of infectious meningitis, prompting health officials to issue a warning to all her classmates. Dr. M. L. Peter, Oklahoma City-county health director, said the victim was Paula Oliver, 17 years old, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. E. E. Brook.

BROOKVILLE, L.I., Nov. 28 -- Hofstra has been playing C. W. Post for only 11 years, and their rivalry has not exactly taken on the capital letter status of "The Game," but they have developed respective roles for their "traditional" Thanksgiving morning game.
"Good morning, everybody. Happy Thanksgiving!" shouted Mike Delehanty at 9 A.M. yesterday as he stood on top of a truck, dressed in a scarlet coat and black top hat. "Let's have a parade."
NEW DELHI, Nov. 28 (UPI) -Prime Minister Indira Gandhi said today that she would attend the British Commonwealth Prime Ministers' conference in London Jan. 15.

NEW YORK, said the president of a large utility company not long ago, "is a magnificent city in which to work and live, but every night when I go to bed I thank God I don't have to operate a utility here."

MADISON, N. J., Nov. 28 -Madison scored twice on long runs and turned three interceptions into touchdowns today to beat Millburn, 42-14. Bob Edwards threw three touchdown passes as Madison scored in every period.
ELIZABETH, N. J., Nov. 28 -Gil Chapman, Thomas Jefferson sophomore halfback, scored five touchdowns as Jefferson erased a 14-0 deficit to defeat Cranford, 32-21, today.

The city's two most significant fund-raising campaigns in the business community -- the Greater New York Fund and the American Red Cross in Greater New York -- are going to follow a wise course in 1969. Instead of running independent and overlapping appeals among corporate and employe groups, they are merging into one United Fund of Greater New York.

GENEVA, Nov. 28 -- France said today that none of the measures she took this week to bolster the franc ran counter to her undertakings as a member of the 76-nation General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade.
LONDON, Nov. 28 -- The endemically cheerful British, hit again by new austerity measures, are beginning to show signs of despair for the future.

BETHPAGE, L. I., Nov. 28 -Steve Moltisanti passed for two touchdowns as Farmingdale closed out its season with a 2113 victory over Bethpage today. It was the sixth victory in eight games for the Dalers and marked the fifth setback in as many games for Bethpage.

GREENVILLE, Miss. (AP) -Two inmates of the Shelby County, Tenn, penal farm lectured pupils here on the "pitfalls of living a life of crime." A short time later, both men eluded their guards and escaped.

LONDON, Nov. 28 (Reuters) -- Member firms of the London Stock Exchange will be required to give information of all transactions they carry out in sterling securities overseas and for nonresidents of the sterling area in Britain, it was announced today.
ROME, Nov. 28 -- Pope Paul VI criticized the activity of his Social Communications Commission today and urged it to work harder in carrying the Roman Catholic message to the world.
SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Nov. 29 -- The intensity of the Vietnam war increased during the last 10 days.
Undefeated Clinton posted its fifth victory yesterday by outscoring Monroe, 21-14, in a Public Schools Athletic League Division II game at Clinton Field.
ROME, Nov. 28 (AP) -- The Rome state attorney ordered the seizure today of the Marquis de Sade book "The 120 Days of Sodom" on the ground it was obscene.

TOKYO, Nov. 28 (Reuters) -A San Francisco couple who left Hong Kong a month ago in a 33-foot cutter, Stornoway, have safely reached Nagasaki, in southern Japan, the Japanese Coast Guard reported today.

WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 -- The dominant impression of a long journey out through the European capitals to Moscow and back is that the Nixon Administration is coming to power precisely when conditions may be more favorable to new initiatives in world politics.

GLEN ROCK, N. J., Nov. 28 -Gary Witt, a halfback, ran for three touchdowns today and Paul McGuire, a quarterback, passed for two to lead River Dell to a 53-0 victory over Glen Rock in a Northern Bergen interscholastic league game.

TOKYO, Nov. 28 -- Communist China's trade with countries of the non-Communist world is deteriorating rapidly, according to a survey published here by the Japan External Trade Organization, a semi governmental agency.

St. John's Prep clinched the Catholic Conference championship yesterday by defeating Brooklyn Prep, 14-7, in the 51st meeting between the rivals at Boys High Field. It was the Redmen's 25th victory in the series, while Brooklyn Prep has won 21 and five games have ended in ties.

RUTHERFORD, N. J., Nov. 28 -- Jim Doane, a quarterback, scored two touchdowns and Nick Mickel Mayer kicked his sixth field goal of the season today as Passaic defeated Rutherford, 22-0. Doane went over from the 1-yard line in the third period and from the 20 in the fourth.
Thanksgiving celebrations were tinged yesterday with reminders of the suffering of the urban poor and of starvation in Biafra as services were held in the city's churches and synagogues.
SAUGERTIES, N. Y., Nov. 28 (AP) -- Two Saugerties hunters and a woman bar proprietor, who sold two city dudes a 10-point buck for $150, found today it was a losing operation.

VERONA, N. J., Nov. 28 -Verona lost a share of the Suburban Conference championship today when Caldwell rallied for two fourth-quarter touchdowns and a 27-19 victory. Trailing, 19-14, Caldwell (5-4) won on Ken Martz's 17-yard run and Roy Mallnak's 7-yard pass to Frank Krannich.
GREENVILLE, S. C., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- Bobby Phelps scored a touchdown and carried the ball for 45 yards in setting a school season rushing record today as Wofford beat Furman, 21-7.

PESHAWAR, Pakistan, Nov. 27 -- Mohammad Asghar Khan, a former commander of Pakistan's Air Force who has taken to the stump as an opposition leader, insists in his speeches that the opposition will have to show strict discipline and unity if it is to bring down the regime of President Mohammad Ayub Khan in elections due next year.

ANKARA, Turkey, Nov. 28 (AP) -- About 750 Turkish students shouting, "Damn America!" jammed Ankara's airport today in a demonstration against the arrival here of the new United States Ambassador, Robert W. Komer.

HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 28 (AP) -- A crackdown on illegal transportation of untaxed liquor into Pennsylvania resuited in the arrest of 63 persons and confiscation of 10 automobiles in a seven-week period, the Pennsylvania Liquor Control Board said today.
CHICAGO, Nov. 28 (AP) -Superintendent of Schools James F. Redmond has proposed a 1969 budget that calls for drastic cuts in school programs and the elimination of more than 6,000 teaching positions.

BERLIN, Nov. 28 -- The East Germans said today that the youth believed to have been killed Monday when a mine blew off both of his legs in an East-West border incident on the Bavarian boundary was still alive and was under treatment in an East German hospital.

COMMACK, L. I., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- Ron Boone, a rookie, scored 11 points in the last 5 1/2 minutes tonight to lead the Dallas Chaparrals to a 110-103 American Basketball Association victory over the New York Nets at the Long Island Arena.
Don Milhaven scored two touchdowns as Holy Cross subdued Flushing, 26-14, yesterday at Memorial field, Flushing.
WEST UNITY, N. H. -- Uncas himself would have fared no better the opening day of our three-day deer hunt in west central New Hampshire, for it was impossible to move silently over the crusted snow.

The 28-day strike by the American Federation of Musicians against the three major broadcasting networks ended yesterday when affected musicians in New York, Los Angeles and Miami voted 270 to 263 to accept a new two-year contract and return to work.

PARIS, Nov. 28 -- American, Vietnamese and French officials are grappling with a problem of diplomatic geometry: How can an international conference be at the same time four-sided, two-sided and triangular?

Tarry Harrison, who is used to running at high altitudes, found New York's low altitude much to his liking yesterday, and ran away with the United States Track and Field Federation cross-country championship at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx.
The American Jewish Congress protested yesterday that the Christmas stamp issued by the United States Post Office violated the separation of church and state guaranteed by the First Amendment.

WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 -- A high-level economic policy adviser to President-elect Richard M. Nixon suggested today a new device for regularly adjusting taxes to stabilize the economy at high employment with a minimum of inflation.

SPARTA, N. J., Nov. 28 -Tom Wright won the state scoring championship today as he scored five touchdowns and led unbeaten Sparta to a 42-0 victory over Franklin. Wright scored 198 points this year and ended his career with 277 points, both school records.

AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- The University of Texas, with an impressive running attack, scored five touchdowns in the first half today and beat Texas A. and M., 35-14, to clinch the host spot in the Cotton Bowl game.
PARIS, Nov. 28 -- The Bank of France reported today a reserve loss equivalent to $174.8million in the week ended Nov. 21, when speculation against the franc threatened to force a devaluation.
SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 28 -- Forest fires swept through five townships in the Blue Mountains 50 miles west of Sydney today, destroying 120 homes, a town's shopping center and vacation homes.
George Henry Debord, 46 years old, the nation's longest surviving heart transplant patient, died yesterday after suffering a series of heart attacks at St. Luke's Hospital in Houston.

GRAND FORKS, N. D., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- The bodies of two young women, who were apparently strangled with a pillow case after a fierce struggle with their attacker, were found yesterday in a small downtown apartment.

LINCOLN, R. I., Nov. 28 (AP) -- After claims of foul were dismissed by the Lincoln Downs' stewards, two longpriced horses were the official winners of both ends of the $7,500 Thanksgiving Day Handicap at Lincoln Downs today.

Like Lainie Kazan, Susan Barrett and dozens of others before her, Gloria Loring needs to find her own style as a cabaret singer. She knows that as well as anyone ("That's what really takes time: finding your own inimitable way").
The development of three types of passenger liners to replace the traditional passenger or cruise ships has been urged by a leading British ship-travel expert.
NEWARK, Nov. 28 -- Policemen and firemen here were reported today to be planning a massive sick-call strike tomorrow to protest low pay.

OSSINING, N.Y., Nov. 28 -More than 200 armed guards searched the Sing Sing Prison complex for five hours tonight and finally found two convicts missing from their cells. They were in the prison knit shop, where they customarily work.
POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Nov. 28 (AP) -- Ted Corbitt, a 48year-old New Yorker running for the Pioneer Club, won the National Amateur Athletic Union 50-mile run today in 5 hours 39 minutes 34.1 seconds.

A selective list of restaurants in New York and vicinity is given on this page on Friday. The restaurants are rated on the basis of four stars to none. The criterion is the food and service in relation to the cost.
Several publishers of textbooks and educational reference books are moving into the glamour field of trade books -- books of fiction and topical subjects.

LONDON, Nov. 28 (AP) -John Lennon's habit of scribbling his million-dollar songs on old envelopes and scraps of paper helped lead to his conviction today for possessing marijuana. He was fined 150 ($360).

LONDON, Nov. 28 (AP) -Premier Mohammed Ahmed Mahgoub of the Sudan arrived by plane today for medical treatment in London. He was taken from the plane on a stretcher and an ambulance drove him to a London clinic.
The New York Jets' annual family Thanksgiving Day party yesterday at Shea Stadium also turned out to be a victory celebration.

PATERSON, N. J., Nov. 28 -Paterson-Eastside and Kennedy battled to a 13-13 tie today in Hinchliffe Stadium. Eastside mounted a final threat that carried 40 yards to the Kennedy 13-yard line but ended there as time ran out.
Robert L. Owens 3d is a salesman.
Pierre Elliott Trudeau, the Prime Minister of Canada, is an urbane man with a special fondness for what he calls "the cultural dynamism of a city like New York."
STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 28 -- Stamford High snapped Fairfield Prep's 23-game winning streak, 22-12, before 7,000 spectators today in Boyle Stadium.

EUREKA, Utah, Nov. 28 (UPI) -- Bruised and half frozen, a 16-year-old boy flagged down a motorist on a snowy Utah highway last night and blurted out that his father and sister were pinned in the wreckage of an airplane three miles away.

Insurance and Securities, Inc., announced yesterday that it had entered into an agreement to acquire all the stock of Manhattan - Guarantee Insurance group. This would add propertycasualty insurance to the San Francisco-based financial services company's present mutual fund and life insurance operations.
WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) -- The Post Office chose Thanksgiving Day to make its annual appeal to the public to "mail early for Christmas."
BAMAKO, Mali, Nov. 28 (Agence France-Presse) -- Mali's airports were officially reopened to normal traffic today. They were closed following last week's ouster of President Modibo Keita.
HONG KONG, Nov. 28 -- Economic specialists here believe that Communist China has agreed to supply Albania with military aid.

Through a hard-hitting editorial in The Crisis, official publication of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, Roy Wilkins says that "the time has come for speaking out loud and clear" against Negro extremists who preach racial hatred, separation and violence. And, clearly, he is right. The extremists must not be allowed to win converts by default.

NIAGARA FALLS, N. Y., Nov. 28 (AP) -- Peter A. Magaddino, who was arrested Tuesday in what the Federal Bureau of Investigation called a crackdown on a vast international Mafia gambling operation, was arrested today on a weapons charge.

LIMA, Peru, Nov. 28 (AP) -The military Government has told the United States that the International Petroleum Company -- whose facilities in Peru were taken over by the Government last month -- is a Canadian company and the United States has no right to intervene in its behalf.
ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Nov. 28 (UPI) -- A jury was seated today to try the kidnapping case of Reies Topez Tijerina, Spanish-American militant.
THE BROTHERS SHUBERT. By Jerry Stagg. 431 pages. Random. $10.

ROME, Nov. 28 -- Pope Paul VI's ministerial "cabinet of Cardinals" met for the third time today to hear a report on the Roman Catholic Church in Hungary and discuss possible dates for a consistory, informed Vatican sources said.
PLAINFIELD, N. J., Nov. 28 -- A 13-yard scoring run by Paul Byrne with less than three minutes to play enabled Westfield High to nip Plainfield, 2521, today.

OAKLAND, Nov. 28 (AP) -George Atkinson's two pass interceptions in the third quarter led Oakland to 10 quick points as the Raiders edged the stubborn Bills, 13-10, in an American Football League game.

The Marine Corps' Lieut. Gen. Lewis W. Walt says: "During my tenure as Com manding General, Third Marine Amphibious Force, I watched, with a great deal of pride and ever-increasing admiration, the outstanding accomplishments of our United Service Organizations, workers in South Vietnam.

EAST MEADOW, L. I., Nov. 28 -- East Meadow drove 51 yards in 10 ground plays in the fourth period to overcome Uniondale, 6-2, today. Steve Solow went over for the touchdown on a 6-yard run. East Meadow's victory created a triple tie among Oceanside, Uniondale and East Meadow for third place in South Shore Division 1 play.

The Rev. David Poling, president of the Christian Herald Association, has expressed opposition to the use of the Rev. Dr. Daniel A. Poling, his uncle, in an advertisement criticizing the National and World Council of Churches.
NEW PROVIDENCE, N. J., Nov. 28 -- Bob Woodruff, quarterback, scored four times today as New Providence whipped Cedar Grove, 37-14, to deadlock with Summit for the Suburban Conference title.
